review_title: WCU one of the best run universities in the tri state area
job_title: Assistant Dean in West Chester, PA
pros:
Quality of management
Quality of the education
Opportunity to accept broad responsibility
cons:
Middle management paid about 2/3rds of Penn. 
Senior management paid less than 50% of Penn.
Faculty paid mid-level for universities in the area

review_title: Beautiful Campus and Place to Gain Experience
job_title: Associate Director in West Chester, PA
pros: Campus community is welcoming, administration is generally supportive and student focused. Overall a great place for learning and professional development and solid medical benefits.
cons: For mid-level professionals (i.e - non-Managerial positions) there is very limited opportunities for upward mobility. A great place to land to gain experience in a position or two, but unfortunately in order to grow professionally in terms of salary and higher-level positions, the next steps to get there tend to be outside of WCU. Also, since WCU is a unionized campus, there is zero flexibility for salary negotiation for non-managerial positions.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in West Chester, PA
pros: It was a inside job. You didn’t have to do much other than help people fix accounts or any technology issues\questions.
cons: The hours were pretty long. I am a college student and it was hard to balance out my education snd this job.

review_title: Overall great university to work for
job_title: Learning Technology Specialist in West Chester, PA
pros: Good benefits and work life balance. Friendly community of faculty, staff, and students.
cons: Doesn't have a ton of room for advancement. If you want to move up, you typically need to go to another university.

job_title: Office Administrator in West Chester, PA

review_title: Worth it for the tuition discount

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Millington, MD
pros: Beautiful campus with some great employees
cons: Union environment that creates a toxic environment

job_title: Desk Associate in West Chester, PA
pros: I worked in Student Recreation for 4 years (year-round) at WCU while going for my undergrad. I worked at Sykes Fitness Center, South Campus Fitness Center, and the new Recreation Center. All three locations were amazing places to work for students. Most importantly, great coworkers and a work/life/school balance.
cons: Since it's a college job, there isn't the best retention rate, even for management. Toward the end of my time there, some of the management seemed to be in and out every year.

job_title: Instructor in West Chester, PA
pros:
-Union protections for adjunct faculty
-Nice campus
-Decent benefits
-There is a conversion policy for non-tenure to tenure after 5 years, but it is left up to the vote of individual departments.  Some departments choose to ignore the process entirely.
cons:
-Adjunct faculty are treated as second class in some departments
-Overtime is only paid at 66% of your normal salary
-There is no orientation process for adjunct faculty, you have to fend for yourself

review_title: Poor Administration--not one of the best places to work in higher education.
job_title: Student Affairs Officer in West Chester, PA
pros: Students for the most part are engaged in the work.
cons:
You never see higher administration at student events. 
Toxic environment to marginalized people.
Poor support from HR when asking for help if you are a new employee.
Confusing union regulations due to number of unions.
Kept on a racist who used racially charged language at a department wide meeting and offered her only a slap on the wrist as a punishment and said she was "brave" for speaking up.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Chester, PA
pros: Everyone was extremely friendly and very positive.  They were all involved throughout the entire process and helped immensely in terms of bringing their vision to life.
cons: Only cons were out of their control, it was hot in the unventilated metal truck, but we all knew that would happen so no issues to really speak of.  If you don't love the work it isn't great because we worked 10-12 hour days every day.

review_title: Probably good if you're not an adjunct
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in West Chester, PA
pros: Nice students, decent pay for adjuncts
cons: Adjuncts' contributions not valued, also although WCU pays better than other places for adjuncts, you never get an increase no matter how many years you work here.

job_title: in West Chester, PA
pros: Great people as peers and the administration staff which are your supervisors are actually more similar to mentors. The hours go by quick because their is always something to do and during down hours, you can just relax and wait for something that needs to be done. Great job
cons: Always open even during snow days or days/times that the building and university typically wouldn't be in use

job_title: Faculty Technology Assistant in West Chester, PA
pros: Great atmosphere to work in. Allows you to learn new software and hardware programs while helping both teachers and students. This position helped me gain an insight into newer programs and access to brand new technology. They worked around my school schedule and helped me with my career after West Chester.
cons: There were no cons, great place to work for

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Chester, PA
pros: Role details change by department, but overall the hours are very flexible and the staff is very directed toward achieving specific goals.
cons: The environment can be somewhat political. The focus on research and empiricism is frustrating. The goals that are established are usually rigid.

review_title: Not a good place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Chester, PA

cons: No raises, no growth opportunities,  no work life balance, management only cares about a select few who are relatives or friends.

review_title: No room to grow, no parking & low pay
job_title: Fiscal Assistant in West Chester, PA

cons: You have to pay for parking and there is no where to park! No room for growth. Very poor pay for a job that requires a degree.

job_title: Professor in West Chester, PA

review_title: It was a life changing experience

review_title: Great place to work and grow professionally
